intro: Streptocarpus caeruleus subsp. longiflorus, commonly known as the blue streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. Its flowers are borne in terminal clusters and are known for their vibrant color and long-lasting bloom. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
